snippet: The expiration of the law exempting ultra-Orthodox Jews from serving in the Israeli army places female soldiers in a more uncertain position.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Shani Boianjiu describes her experience of the tension that exists in the Israeli military between secular women and religiously observant men; observes that the expiration of the law exempting ultra-Orthodox Jews from serving in the army places female soldiers in a more uncertain position, but may serve to clarify the relationship between secular and religious Israelis.
lead_paragraph: The expiration of the law exempting ultra-Orthodox Jews from serving in the Israeli army places female soldiers in a more uncertain position.

headline.main: What Happens When the Two Israels Meet
headline.print_headline: What Happens When The Two Israels Meet
